data.title: Excellent!
data.text: My server Allison was awesome!  I had the surf and turf which was superb. Also the steamed Cajun muscles for an appetizer were excellent as well.  Portions sizes were great.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: We were in town for a conference and decided to try The Roxy Supper Club based on reviews on Tripadvisor. It was an axcellent choice. Both our dinners were excellent and their service exceptional. We will be back next time we are in town

data.title: Good German Food
data.text: Typical supper club food, however they have good cocktails and they have god German food, try the schnitzel!

data.title: Disappointing evening
data.text: We had a reservation for 4 people at 5:45 P.M., gathering together as a family in rememberance of the fifth anniversary of my father's passing. Very shortly after we sat down at the table, the waiter wanted to take our order. We hadn't looked through the extensive menu yet and asked for a few more minutes. The waiter agreed but took much longer than a few minutes to come back so we needed to flag down what turned out to be the evening manager so that we could order from our waiter. Tuesdays are German night. Two of us ordered German food from the list and the other two ordered evening specials. You would have thought all four of these entrees would have been readily available since they were all evening specials. One by one, we watched every table in our area that was seated after us receive our food before us. The service was very slow. Without us saying anything, the waiter recognized how slow the service was and offered to buy us a drink. Due to the fact that we already had two drinks and would be driving separately, we politely declined. It took 1 hour and 20 minutes to receive our food. Three of us left half of our entrees due to the poor quality of the food. My husband said that it was the worst hot German potato salad that he ever had-thought it was scraped from the bottom of a burnt pan. Again, without us saying anything, the waiter said that he would talk to the manager about adjusting the bill. The bill was adjusted one entree or $15 less. It really wasn't much of a discount for the slow service and poor quality food. We were so disgusted by the poor service that it really put a damper on the evening. What should have been a nice family get-together turned out to be a very aggravating night!

data.title: Spontaneous Breakfast!
data.text:
In Oshkosh, not many places are open for breakfast on Sunday's. We decided that after living here for 6 years it was time to try The Roxy, and boy are we sad we didn't try it sooner!
We shared a plate of the Pumpkin Pancakes and an amazing vegetable skillet. AWESOME! Our server was perfect, she checked on us when necessary and always kept our coffee's full :)
The price was extremely reasonable and we're excited to return next sunday!

data.title: Disappointing Birthday Dinner!
data.text:
Trip Advisor has been such a fantastic tool for us, everywhere we travel.  We always consult TA first, and have found some amazing places, whether it be restaurant or hotel. I attended college in Oshkosh way back in 1984 and had never been to the Roxy all this time.  It's rated #2 in Oshkosh, so I was excited to try it for my boyfriend's birthday dinner.   
Our dinner was rough from the very start.  We ordered the almost required, in order to rate a supper club in WI, Old Fashion.  Our drinks were so watered down and bland, we didn't even have a second.  That is a first for us, I have to admit.  
We then had salads, which were fine, and a piece of bread.  After eating the bread, we noticed that the bread had been served on top of crackers which were completely and totally crushed up by whomever they had been served to previously.  They were indeed mangled.  As we discovered this, we thought about the grubby hands that had handled these crackers and left them in this state.  We then remembered that we had just eaten a piece of bread that had been laying right on top of these grubby packages and felt somewhat sick.  
Our meal arrived shortly afterward and we hoped to forget our previous experience by enjoying a fabulous main course.  My boyfriend ordered a ribeye which was completely and totally plain, without any seasoning.  I ordered chicken cordon bleu, which was more than overcooked and I was unable to even chew the chicken.  
The waitress arrived, after we hadn't seen her in quite a long while and asked how our meal was.  Not wanting to be rude, we simply responded...."ok".  She asked, just ok?  She asked several times why we just thought our meal was ok.  We very nicely detailed our review of each step of the meal.  She asked if i'd like a box to take home my uneaten chicken.  I kind of chuckled, thinking that if I wasn't able to chew the chicken now (and had left most of it on my plate), I most certainly wouldn't be able to reheat it and attempt to eat it again.  I did explain that I was disappointed with our dinner, especially considering it was my boyfriend's birthday dinner.  
She returned after an uncomfortable period of time with our check and to offer us an after dinner drink on the house for our disappointment in our meal.  Honestly, our Old Fashion's had been so poor, we were afraid to even try a drink "on the house".  We did opt for a grasshopper, which was very, very good.  The waitress also returned with a small birthday cake for my boyfriend, which was also good.    
As many friends have raved about the Roxy and TA's ratings were also so high, we were completely and totally taken aback by our visit.  It was more than disappointing and we doubt we will ever willingly choose to visit again.

data.title: The Roxy
data.text: The food and service was good.  Reservations are needed.  Parking is limited.  The atmosphere is fair.  Typical supper club.  Like many supper clubs there was not a salad bar.  I have been there several times.

data.title: The Roxy
data.text: If you are going to eat at this place make sure you make reservations. We did and those who did not had about an hour and half wait. Great food and service.

data.title: Great Food  Great Service
data.text:
My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch on our anniversary.  The service was fast and friendly.  We tried the broiled scallops and the seafood platter and both were excellent.  The scallops were perfectly cooked.  
After hearing it was our anniversary, they brought us a "Best Wishes" cake from Manderfield's Bakery for us to enjoy at home.
Great food, great prices and great service.  
Would highly recommend!

data.title: Great service!
data.text: Great waiters and waitresses, very fast and friendly service. They have a bar area and an area for business lunches or dinners. Large variety of food. Resonably priced.

data.title: My Favorite Place for Prime Rib
data.text: This is a go to place for Prime Rib on Saturdays or Fish on Sundays. A supper club worth the wait.. You won't be disappointed. In fact you will be traveling back to town like me just for the Roxy!

data.title: The Roxy Supper Club 571 N Main St, Oshkosh, WI 54901-4908
data.text:
Attended a group get together at the Roxy on Monday evening. You would think that on a Monday night, there would not be many people there - the bar was full and many people were eating. Says something about the food and service. I had the "Chicken Supreme" - Melt in your mouth tender Chicken topped with shrimp, scallions and mushrooms in a creamy wine sauce. Could not eat all of it - had to take something home for the dog (me). Wife had her favorite "Open-Faced Tenderloin" -
Served on toast with homemade onion rings. Both were extremely tasty. Service by one waitress for our whole group was fantastic. Large size Old Fashions to top all of this off. Soup, salad, entree and rolls = $13-16.00

data.title: Decent food, friendly service
data.text: We had a very friendly waitress. She was very helpful and a joy to have around. We sat on the dining side rather than the pub side, but the pub spilled over into the dining. We had a couple drunk annoying ladies a few tables down from us. At first they were funny, but then got annoying real quick. The food was decent, just bland. We all had separate dishes but all thought the same.

data.title: Been around a long time--good
data.text:
A 50 year old supper club. Apparently, once common in Wisconsin. A bit dark but from what I have seen, normal decor in Oshkosh. 

Great food for a reasonable price. Known for their prime rib. Great cut and delicious. One of the best Old Fashioned drinks I've had. Great bar and beer selection and priced perfectly. A nice bar scene as well. In downtown Oshkosh. A must see. Call ahead...they get busy! 

They are NOT on Open Table.

data.title: Another Great Wisconsin Supper Club
data.text: We were directed to walk to this restaurant from our bed and breakfast, and it was great! Do not let the exterior fool you - it is a great place to eat!

data.title: Family Place
data.text: We made reservations because we had 12 adults and two babies and celebrating a birthday and Jess are waitress took care of us with our orders and everything we needed , we were very happy with the service great family place to dine .

data.title: Always the right choice!
data.text: Excellent food...from the pizza soup to the stir fry...we were all very impressed.  I have tried many things on their menu so like to try something different each time I am there. I don't think there's a bad choice.

data.title: Lacked flavor
data.text:
This restaurant was recommended to us by our hotel staff.

It was downtown and parking was pretty easy.

We got seated fairly quickly and the waitstaff was OK.

Good was just average.  It was on the bland side.  It didn't have any flavor that made the food pop! We tried adding salt to see if we could bring out some seasoning and flavor, no go.

The chicken dumpling soup was probably the best part of the dinner

don't think we will try it again.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Great food, great drinks and nice atmosphere. Especially love Their Italian platter of tortellini Alfredo, chicken Parmesan and spiedini

data.title: The Best Wisconsin Supper Club
data.text: By far the best food and supper club experience. May I suggest, starting out your dining experience with an authentic Old Fashion or a glass of Piesporter wine.  My favorite menu is the Grilled Portabella Mushroom open face Sandwich loaded with grilled vegetables, Spinach with Bacon Salad, Wild Rice (the best) and grilled asparagus. My husband loves the steaks and fish selections, but then everything at the Roxy is delicious. Be sure to call and make reservations early in the week. Get there early so you can enjoy a cocktail before dinner. Make this your special date night.  Not a perfect choice for young children as the wait can be long and the night truly belongs to you and your date. Take the kids to a more family restaurant where they can be kids. Truly the traditional Wisconsin supper club experience.
